description:
The Product & Partner Go-To-Market (PPG) team launches and lands new products, policies, and content strategies that make YouTube the world’s top destination for video. Our team of expert Product Specialists provides a unified voice for Product across several other key teams — including Surfaces & Apps, Content Creation & Engagement, Monetization, and Rights & Content Management — as well as the Partnership Enablement team, which brings product, policy, and content strategies to market via all the partner-facing teams across Google’s business.

The Product and Partner Go To Market (PPG) team is focused on activating and educating YouTube consumers, content partners, and our internal Operations teams. Our multifaceted professionals work together with teams throughout YouTube to address users’ needs to be successful on YouTube. We help develop go-to-market resources for products and policies that are strategically important for YouTube’s ecosystems.

Within PPG, the YouTube Product Specialist team is a product focused team with the core mission to launch and push adoption of products and policies that enable YouTube’s success. As a Product Specialist, you will serve as a product expert and end-user. You will also act as an internal product expert for operations teams, and you will collect and analyze data to influence product roadmaps and the prioritization of product features.

At YouTube, we believe that everyone deserves to have a voice, and that the world is a better place when we listen, share, and build community through our stories. We work together to give everyone the power to share their story, explore what they love, and connect with one another in the process. Working at the intersection of cutting-edge technology and boundless creativity, we move at the speed of culture with a shared goal to show people the world. We explore new ideas, solve real problems, and have fun — and we do it all together.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • Experience in technical operations.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Knowledge of SQL and advanced spreadsheets.
  • Understanding of YouTube landscape, workflows, and products.
  • Proven success in project management and execution, multi-tasking, and delegating.
  • Ability to work independently on project deliverables in a fast-paced and ambiguous technical environment.
  • Passion and awareness of streaming video and YouTube.
  • Excellent communication skills and attention to detail.
responsibilities:
• Provide strategic insights and lead continuous product improvement efforts at YouTube, working closely with Product and Engineering teams.
  • Prioritize feedback and ideas based on robust data. Build business cases in order to embed requests within product roadmaps.
  • Be a product expert and serve as a consultant for the Partnership and Operations teams. Be responsible for product knowledge dissemination in the organization.
  • Work with other teams to guarantee market readiness, communications, trainings, and support for launches. Manage technical issues from the field and provide guidance on resolution to Partnership teams.
  • Plan, coordinate, and manage launch, activation, and adoption activities for key product features and platform changes to content partnerships.
title: Product Specialist, YouTube
